headerText: Vuetify comes with a 12 point grid system built using <kbd>flex-box</kbd>. The grid is used to create specific layouts within an application's content.  It contains 5 types of media breakpoints that are used for targeting specific screen sizes or orientations, **xs**, **sm**, **md**, **lg** and **xl**. These resolutions are defined below in the Viewport Breakpoints table and can be modified by customizing the [Breakpoint service](/customization/breakpoints).

usage.desc: The `v-container` can be used for a center focused page, or given the `fluid` prop to extend its full width. `v-row` is used as a wrapper for the `v-col` component. The structure of your layout will be as follows, **v-container** » **v-row** » **v-col**. Each part of the grid chain is a flex-box element.

playground.desc: Test the layout props in a simple playground.

offset.desc: Offsets are useful for compensating for elements that may not be visible yet, or to control the position of content. Just as with breakpoints, you can set an offset for any available sizes. This allows you to fine tune your application layout precisely to your needs.

order.desc: You can control the ordering of grid items. As with offsets, you can set different orders for different sizes. Design specialized screen layouts that accommodate to any application.

direction-and-align.desc: Designate the direction and alignment in a variety of ways. All of the available <kbd>flex-box</kbd> api is available through intuitive helper props.

row-column-breakpoint.desc: Dynamically change your layout based upon resolution. **(resize your screen and watch the layout change to a `row` on small breakpoints)**

grow-shrink.desc: By default, flex components will automatically fill the available space in a row or column. They will also shrink relative to the rest of the flex items in the flex container when there isn't enough space in the row or column. To disable the grow behavior, use the `shrink` attribute. To disable the shrink behavior, use the `grow` attribute. To disable both the grow and shrink behavior, use the `grow-shrink-0` attribute.

nested-grid.desc: Grids can be nested, similar to other frameworks, in order to achieve very custom layouts.

unique-layouts.desc: The power and flexibility of the Vuetify grid system allows you to create amazing user interfaces.

spacer.desc: The `v-spacer` component is useful when you want to fill available space or make space between two components.

tags.desc: Sometimes you will want to specify a layout item as a specific tag, such as a `section` or `li` element.

v-col.alignSelf: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **auto**, **baseline** and **stretch**.
v-col.cols: Sets the default number of columns the component extends. Available options are **1 -> 12** and **auto**.
v-col.sm: Changes the number of columns on small and greater breakpoints.
v-col.md: Changes the number of columns on medium and greater breakpoints.
v-col.lg: Changes the number of columns on large and greater breakpoints.
v-col.xl: Changes the number of columns on extra large and greater breakpoints.
v-col.offset: Sets the default offset for the column.
v-col.offsetSm: Changes the offset of the component on small and greater breakpoints.
v-col.offsetMd: Changes the offset of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.
v-col.offsetLg: Changes the offset of the component on large and greater breakpoints.
v-col.offsetXl: Changes the offset of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.
v-col.order: Sets the default [order](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/order) for the column.
v-col.orderSm: Changes the order of the component on small and greater breakpoints.
v-col.orderMd: Changes the order of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.
v-col.orderLg: Changes the order of the component on large and greater breakpoints.
v-col.orderXl: Changes the order of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-row.align: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **space-between**, **space-around** and **stretch**.
v-row.alignSm: Changes the **align-items** property on small and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignMd: Changes the **align-items** property on medium and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignLg: Changes the **align-items** property on large and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignXl: Changes the **align-items** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignContent: Applies the [align-content](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-content) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **space-between**, **space-around** and **stretch**.
v-row.alignContentSm: Changes the **align-content** property on small and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignContentMd: Changes the **align-content** property on medium and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignContentLg: Changes the **align-content** property on large and greater breakpoints.
v-row.alignContentXl: Changes the **align-content** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.
v-row.justify: Applies the [justify-content](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/justify-content) css property. Available options are **start**, **center**, **end**, **space-between** and **space-around**.
v-row.justifySm: Changes the **justify-content** property on small and greater breakpoints.
v-row.justifyMd: Changes the **justify-content** property on medium and greater breakpoints.
v-row.justifyLg: Changes the **justify-content** property on large and greater breakpoints.
v-row.justifyXl: Changes the **justify-content** property on extra large and greater breakpoints.
